summary: A memorandum for the record detailing discussions from a Special Group meeting on September 20, 1962, covering topics such as anti-Castro activities, the use of FIRE FLY, balloon operations over Cuba, and plans related to North Vietnam and Tibet.
summary_one_paragraph: This memorandum summarizes discussions from the Special Group meeting held on September 20, 1962, addressing various clandestine operations and policy matters. Key topics included the disapproval of FIRE FLY use over Kamchatka but enthusiastic consideration of its use against Cuba, balloon operations involving exiles over Cuba, and strategic considerations for operations in North Vietnam, including overflight requirements and limitations on involving Chinese Nationalist personnel. Additionally, the meeting covered the selection of Carl Hummelsine to lead an ambassadorial counter-insurgency team to Africa, approved support to the Apra Party in Peru, and discussed the need to involve India in operations related to Tibet, along with updates on security advice to Colombia and communications problems.
title: Memorandum for the Record, Special Group Meeting 20 September 1962
